member.name: T:Vext.Compiler.Lexing.TokenType
member.summary: Defines the different types of tokens that can be identified by the lexer.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Lexing.TokenType.Identifier
member.summary: Represents an identifier token such as names for variables, functions, etc.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Lexing.TokenType.Keyword
member.summary: Represents a keyword token such as reserved words in the language (int, float, bool, void, if, else, etc.).

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Lexing.TokenType.String
member.summary: Represents a string literal token.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Lexing.TokenType.Numeric
member.summary: Represents a numeric literal token.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Lexing.TokenType.Operator
member.summary: Represents an operator token such as +, -, *, /, %, ==, !=, <, <=, >, >=, &&, ||, !, =, etc.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Lexing.TokenType.Punctuation
member.summary: Represents a punctuation token such as ;, ,, (, ), {, }, etc.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Lexing.TokenType.Boolean
member.summary: Represents a boolean literal token (true, false).

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Lexing.TokenType.EOF
member.summary: Represents the end-of-file token.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Lexing.TokenType.Unknown
member.summary: Represents an unknown or unrecognized token.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.Parser.Parse
member.summary: Parses the input token stream and returns a list of statement nodes representing the parsed statements.
member.remarks: If a parsing error occurs, the method attempts to recover and continue parsing subsequent statements. Errors encountered during parsing are reported and do not cause the method to throw exceptions under normal circumstances.
member.returns: A list of objects corresponding to the successfully parsed statements. The list may be empty if no valid statements are found.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.Parser.ParseStatement(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses the next statement from the current position in the token stream.
member.remarks: This method advances the parser's position as it consumes tokens for a statement. If the input is invalid or incomplete, the method attempts to recover by skipping to the next logical statement boundary. The returned node may represent various statement types, such as variable declarations, function declarations, control flow statements, assignments, or expression statements, depending on the current token context.
member.returns: A representing the parsed statement, or if no valid statement could be parsed.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.Parser.ParsePrimary(Vext.Compiler.Lexing.Token)
member.summary: Parses a primary expression from the specified token and returns the corresponding expression node.
member.remarks: Primary expressions include literals (numeric, string, boolean), variable references, function calls, module function calls, parenthesized expressions, and unary operations (such as negation or logical not). If the token does not represent a valid primary expression, a dummy literal node is returned and an error is reported.
member.param: The token representing the start of the primary expression to parse. Must not be null.
member.returns: An ExpressionNode representing the parsed primary expression, such as a literal, variable, function call, or unary operation.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.Parser.ParseExpression(System.Int32)
member.summary: Parses an expression from the current token position, respecting operator precedence rules.
member.remarks: This method advances the current token position as it parses the expression. Assignment operators ('=') are not allowed and will result in an error and a fallback literal node. The method is intended for use within the parser's expression parsing logic and assumes that the token list and current position are valid.
member.param: The minimum operator precedence to consider when parsing the expression. Operators with lower precedence are not parsed at this level. Defaults to 0.
member.returns: An ExpressionNode representing the parsed expression subtree. Returns a LiteralNode with a default value if parsing fails due to invalid syntax or unexpected end of input.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.Parser.Match(Vext.Compiler.Lexing.TokenType,System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to match the current token against the specified token type and optional value, advancing to the next token if successful.
member.param: The expected type of the current token to match.
The expected value of the current token to match, or null to match any value.
member.returns: true if the current token matches the specified type and value; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.Parser.Expect(Vext.Compiler.Lexing.TokenType,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the next token if it matches the specified type and, optionally, value; otherwise, reports an error and returns a fallback token to allow parsing to continue.
member.remarks: If the next token does not match the specified criteria, an error is reported and a fallback token is returned to enable error recovery during parsing. This method allows the parser to continue processing input after encountering unexpected tokens.
member.param: The expected type of the token to match.
The expected value of the token to match, or null to match any value.
member.returns: The matched token if the next token matches the specified type and value; otherwise, a fallback token representing the current position.

member.name: T:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.ExpressionNode
member.summary: Represents a node in an expression tree, such as a value or an operation.
member.remarks: ExpressionNode instances are typically used to model the structure of parsed expressions, including literals, variables, and operators. This class serves as a base for more specific expression node types.

member.name: P:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.ExpressionNode.Line
member.summary: The line number in the source code where this expression appears

member.name: P:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.ExpressionNode.StartColumn
member.summary: The column number in the source code where this expression appears

member.name: P:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.ExpressionNode.EndColumn
member.summary: The ending column number in the source code where this expression ends

member.name: T:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.StatementNode
member.summary: Represents a statement in the abstract syntax tree (AST) of the programming language.

member.name: P:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.StatementNode.Line
member.summary: Represents the line number in the source code where this statement appears.

member.name: P:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.StatementNode.StartColumn
member.summary: Represents the column number in the source code where this statement appears.

member.name: P:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.StatementNode.EndColumn
member.summary: Represents the ending column number in the source code where this statement ends.

member.name: T:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.FunctionParameterNode
member.summary: Represents a function parameter in a function definition.

member.name: P:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.FunctionParameterNode.SlotIndex
member.summary: The slot index assigned to this parameter for variable storage.

member.name: P:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.FunctionParameterNode.Type
member.summary: The data type of the parameter (e.g., "int", "float", "string").

member.name: P:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.FunctionParameterNode.Name
member.summary: The name of the parameter.

member.name: P:Vext.Compiler.Parsing.FunctionParameterNode.Initializer
member.summary: An optional initializer expression for the parameter.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.Semantic.SemanticPass.RegisterBuiltInFunctions(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Vext.Modules.Function})
member.summary: Registers a collection of built-in functions for use within the current context.
member.remarks: If a function with the same name already exists among the built-ins, the new function is added alongside existing definitions. This allows for function overloading by name.
member.param: The collection of built-in functions to register. Each function in the collection must have a unique name within the set of built-ins.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.Semantic.SemanticPass.CollectFunctions
member.summary: Analyzes the collection of statements to identify and register all function definitions, validating their signatures and reporting any errors found.
member.remarks: This method checks for duplicate function definitions, unknown return or parameter types, and duplicate parameter names within each function. Any issues encountered during validation are reported as errors. Only valid function definitions are added to the internal function registry.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.Semantic.SemanticPass.AnalyzeStatement(Vext.Compiler.Parsing.StatementNode,Vext.Compiler.Parsing.FunctionDefinitionNode)
member.summary: Analyzes a single statement node for semantic correctness within the context of the specified function.
member.remarks: This method performs semantic checks such as type compatibility, variable declaration and assignment validation, and ensures that control flow constructs are analyzed correctly. Errors encountered during analysis are reported through the error reporting mechanism. The analysis may update the state of variable assignments and perform constant folding on expressions where applicable.
member.param: The statement node to analyze. Must not be null.
The function definition node that provides the context for analysis, or null if the statement is not within a function.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.Semantic.SemanticPass.CheckExpression(Vext.Compiler.Parsing.ExpressionNode,Vext.Compiler.Parsing.FunctionDefinitionNode)
member.summary: Performs semantic checks on the specified expression node, validating variable usage and assignment within the current function context.
member.remarks: This method reports errors for variables that are used before declaration or may be unassigned at the point of use. It recursively checks sub-expressions as needed.
member.param: The expression node to be checked for semantic correctness.
The function definition node representing the current function context, or null if the expression is not within a function.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.Semantic.SemanticPass.Fold(Vext.Compiler.Parsing.ExpressionNode)
member.summary: Performs constant folding on the specified expression tree, simplifying expressions by evaluating constant sub-expressions where possible.
member.remarks: Constant folding reduces expressions such as arithmetic or logical operations on literals to a single literal node. Expressions that cannot be evaluated at compile time are left unchanged. Division by zero is detected and reported, but the original expression is returned in such cases.
member.param: The root node of the expression tree to be folded. Must not be null.
member.returns: An expression tree equivalent to the input, with constant sub-expressions replaced by their evaluated results where possible. Returns the original node if no folding can be performed.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.Semantic.SemanticPass.GetExpressionType(Vext.Compiler.Parsing.ExpressionNode)
member.summary: Determines the type of the specified expression node as a string representation.
member.remarks: The returned type string corresponds to the language's supported types. If the expression is a function or module call, the method attempts to resolve overloads based on argument types. If no matching overload is found or the expression is not recognized, the method returns "error" and may report an error for diagnostic purposes.
member.param: The expression node to analyze. Must not be null.
member.returns: A string representing the type of the expression, such as "int", "float", "bool", or "string". Returns "error" if the type cannot be determined or if the expression is invalid.

member.summary: Reprsent Arg in integer form

member.name: P:Vext.Compiler.Shared.Instruction.ArgVal
member.summary: Gets the argument value as a instance.

member.summary: Represents the line number in the source code where this instruction was generated.

member.name: P:Vext.Compiler.Shared.Instruction.ColumnNumber
member.summary: Represents the column number in the source code where this instruction was generated.

member.name: T:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode
member.summary: Defines the set of bytecode instructions supported by the Vext virtual machine.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.DEF_FUNC
member.summary: Defines a function.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.LOAD_CONST
member.summary: Loads a constant value onto the stack.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.LOAD_VAR
member.summary: Loads a variable value onto the stack.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.STORE_VAR
member.summary: Stores the top stack value into a variable.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.ADD
member.summary: Adds the top two stack values.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.SUB
member.summary: Subtracts the top stack value from the previous one.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.MUL
member.summary: Multiplies the top two stack values.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.DIV
member.summary: Divides the previous stack value by the top value.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.POW
member.summary: Raises the previous stack value to the power of the top value.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.MOD
member.summary: Computes the remainder of division.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.EQ
member.summary: Checks equality of the top two stack values.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.NEQ
member.summary: Checks inequality of the top two stack values.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.LT
member.summary: Checks if the previous stack value is less than the top value.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.GT
member.summary: Checks if the previous stack value is greater than the top value.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.LTE
member.summary: Checks if the previous stack value is less than or equal to the top value.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.GTE
member.summary: Checks if the previous stack value is greater than or equal to the top value.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.NOT
member.summary: Logical NOT of the top stack value.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.CALL
member.summary: Calls a function and pushes the return value.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.CALL_VOID
member.summary: Calls a function and discards the return value.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.RET
member.summary: Returns from the current function.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.JMP
member.summary: Unconditional jump.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.JMP_IF_FALSE
member.summary: Jumps if the top stack value is false.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.JMP_IF_TRUE
member.summary: Jumps if the top stack value is true.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.POP
member.summary: Removes the top value from the stack.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.INC_VAR
member.summary: Increments variable by 1.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.DEC_VAR
member.summary: Decrements the variable by 1.

member.name: F:Vext.Compiler.Shared.VextVMBytecode.JMP_IF_VAR_OP_CONST
member.summary: Jump if var {op} constant

member.name: T:Vext.Compiler.VM.VextVM
member.summary: Represents a virtual machine for executing Vext bytecode instructions, supporting user-defined and built-in functions, variables, and modules.
member.remarks: The VextVM class provides an execution environment for Vext scripts, managing the runtime stack, variable storage, and function/module resolution. It supports both native and user-defined functions, as well as module-based function organization. Instances of this class are not thread-safe and should not be shared across threads without external synchronization.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.VM.VextVM.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{Vext.Compiler.Modules.Module},Vext.Compiler.Modules.DefaultFunctions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the VextVM class with the specified modules and default functions.
member.param: A list of modules to load into the virtual machine. If null, no modules are loaded.
An object containing default functions to load into the virtual machine. If null, no default functions are loaded.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.VM.VextVM.Run(System.Collections.Generic.List{Vext.Compiler.Shared.Instruction},System.Int32@)
member.summary: Executes a sequence of virtual machine instructions and returns the result of the computation.
member.remarks: The method processes instructions sequentially, updating the stack and variable state as required. The stack pointer parameter is modified to reflect the final stack state after execution. The method supports a variety of operations, including arithmetic, logical, control flow, and function calls. If a RET instruction is encountered, the value at the top of the stack is returned immediately.
member.param: The list of instructions to execute. Each instruction represents an operation to be performed by the virtual machine. Cannot be null.
A reference to the current stack pointer. This value is updated to reflect the stack state as instructions are executed.
member.returns: The result value produced by the executed instructions. If the instruction sequence does not explicitly return a value, a value of type Null is returned.
member.exception: Thrown if an invalid operation is encountered during execution, such as stack underflow, invalid variable access, type mismatch, or an invalid jump target.

member.name: M:Vext.Compiler.VM.VextVM.GetVariables
member.summary: Gets the collection of variables associated with this instance.
member.returns: An array of objects representing the variables. The array may be empty if no variables are defined.

member.name: T:Vext.Modules.Function
member.summary: Represents a function within a module or as a defaultFunction.

member.summary: Represents a function within a module or as a defaultFunction.
